content.location: Bolt line to the right of the dihedral.

content.description: Up the face, past two clips, to the ledge.  Continue up the face to a juggy rail, encountering a very thin crux where the route jogs right.  Finish up steep climbing on large holds to the anchor.
content.location: To the left of the very popular Dragon Kite.

content.description:
An uncharacteristically long climb for the area. A fun engaging route that includes several different types of climbing, technical face, a steep roof, liebacking, and slabby crimping. 

  Climb through a short technical face and the first crux at the second bolt before traversing right underneath a roof. Consider backcleaning a little or using long runners to minimize the rope drag there. Pull the roof and follow good holds to a thin bulge before the anchor.
content.location: Climbers left around the corner from Dragon Kite. Climbs underneath the obvious tiered roofs.

content.description: Great Thacher Climb! Slabby start. A layback somewhere.
content.location: Slab start on the wall right under the roof just right of Puckered and Tuckered. Gets great sun on a clear day.

climbs.name: Cosmik Debris
climbs.fa: Pat Thompson and Mike Whelan. Sept 2016

content.description: Hard roof start.  Interesting varied and sometimes reachy dihedral moves.  There were spiders everywhere when I climbed this.
content.location: In the corner on the left.

content.description: one of the better climbs at Thatcher! thin, steep, sustained, with one big move.    climb up past one bolt onto a big ledge. from there clip a bolt on the lightly-colored rock and continue up through increasingly thinner and reachier climbing until committing up over a small roof and onto a ledge. the bolts are bizarrely out of reach for most from this ledge, but one little move on small holds resolves that quickly! enjoy!!
content.location: middle-left of dark block wall. the line climbs over a lightly-colored boot-shaped section of rock just above the big ledge.

content.description: A collection of quality routes from 10a to 11c with one of the most popular climbs at Thacher: Dragon Kite (10b).  Dark Block tends to be steeper with more positive holds than the other walls at Thacher.  The wall is divided part way up by a large ledge, routes on the left side tend to begin below this ledge, while routes on the right begin above it.
